meanings.definition: The behavior or characteristics of a maenad.
meanings.sent1: Her maenadism was evident in her wild dancing and ecstatic expressions.
meanings.sent2: The maenadism of the women during the festival was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent3: The maenadism of the group of friends at the party made everyone join in the fun.
meanings.sent4: His maenadism on the soccer field was like a whirlwind of energy and passion.
meanings.sent5: The maenadism of the forest creatures at night was both enchanting and eerie.

meanings.definition: The worship or devotion to the god Dionysus.
meanings.sent1: Their maenadism involved singing and dancing in honor of Dionysus.
meanings.sent2: The ancient Greeks practiced maenadism as part of their religious ceremonies.
meanings.sent3: The maenadism of the villagers was so fervent that it seemed to bring them closer to the divine.
meanings.sent4: Her maenadism was like a beacon of faith shining brightly in the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The maenadism of the worshippers filled the temple with joy and reverence.

meanings.definition: The state of being a maenad.
meanings.sent1: In her maenadism, she felt a deep connection to nature and the spiritual realm.
meanings.sent2: The maenadism of the priestess was a symbol of her dedication to her beliefs.
meanings.sent3: His maenadism was so strong that it seemed to radiate from his very being.

meanings.sent5: The village celebrated the arrival of spring with a display of maenadism and joy.
